comments.commentBody: Day after day after day. What will it take for Republicans to admit that the man is seriously mentally ill and unfit for office? I pray that, as with Nixon, behind the scenes plans are in place to prevent people from acting upon orders Trump may issue that are truly dangerous, e.g., launching a nuclear attack. If they are not................

I believe Trump the same way I believed him when he said millions of people voted illegally, Obama was born in Kenya, and global warning is a hoax concocted by China.  I also appreciate the way he makes snap decisions without liberal-elite "evidence" and pointy-headed analysis.  Who better to have his finger on the nuclear trigger?  What a man!
I think Trump is about to be held accountable for this series of tweets.  Sorry, his tweets are news.  He's POTUS.

I have serious concerns about the health of President Trump. He seems to think he can say anything, at any time, without any repercussions. This is such careless and appalling behavior for the President of the United States that I am aghast. I am embarrassed.

So far, Trump has offered zero evidence about his Obama accusation. Either provide us evidence or apologize to us.
How about Trump's birtherism nonsense? It got him to the White House. Trump isn't the only sick one...
Funny. You sound as if you've been away on a two-year retreat and just arrived to see what's been happening.
Yeah, and you better build a dugout in your backyard in case Putin decides to push the button down.

Keep your eye on the ball, NYT.

This claim by the so-called "president," unsupported by any evidence, as is his custom, is a "shiny object" intended to distract our attention from the Russia issue.

"Paranoia is a thought process believed to be heavily influenced by anxiety or fear, often to the point of delusion and irrationality...Paranoid thinking typically includes persecutory, or beliefs of conspiracy concerning a perceived threat towards oneself (e.g. 'Everyone is out to get me')."
"It has generally been agreed upon that individuals with paranoid delusions will have the tendency to take action based on their beliefs."

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paranoia

Time for Pence and the U.S. Senate to take into consideration the likelihood Trump is unfit to serve - before his actions jeopardize the safety of the American people.
and all other people. . .

I don't disagree with your diagnosis of Trump...  But your assumption that Pence is somehow better is arguable.  Pence is a slick operator who knows how to get things done...  And his agenda is, in my opinion, in some ways worse.
Mr. Trump as usual overplays his hand. However, the lawyerly response from Mr. Obama's spokespeople makes one wonder if others (FBI, Justice) may have played a role.
It's the FBI. They got a warrant from the FISA court in October.

Trump's latest tweet concerns the fact that a key CIA officer, a holdover from the Obama administration, is suffering from bipolar disorder and therefore poses a "great risk to national security." In a follow-up interview, the president calls the lapse "tragic, and typical of the previous administration's incompetence. It's sad, really." He expresses outrage that he wasn't briefed about the situation during the transition.

When informed that he's describing the plot of the Showtime series "Homeland," which is entirely fictional, the president says that it's the First Lady's fault. "She must have changed the channel when I made a quick visit to the Lincoln bedroom. She does that. It's sad, really."
Nice one. Had a good laugh, now go get that remote away from Melania.
did not pres  reagan relate stories as real which were only the plots of movies he appeared in ?

KB,

You might want to ask China about the NK threat to China. The Chinese created the problem, maintained it since the '50's and are now having serious second thoughts about it, with no way to eliminate the problem.

Dear President Trump,
1... the reason you're so backwards on cybersecurity is because the secretive NSA spent the money on corperations that would throw them lavish parties, rather than corperations that could actually do the job. It's called "Lack of Accountability" and it always works out that way.

2...Start outfitting your inter contininental missiles with non-nuclear weapons, so that you can actually start shooting them at people like North Korea, rather than sitting in a dank hole in the ground that no one dares fire. Nothing will frighten a dictator more than an incoming continental missile and they don't know what's on it.

3...Age of "Sabatage their supply line" meet age of "3D printers...we don't have a supply line anymore"
I doubt the problem would go away if the Republicans get their acts together.  If so, Obama would have solved the problem already with the effective  Democratic Party behind him.
You don't surely think the NYT is responsible for drumming up North Korea's missle insanity, do you? -- This has been going on since the 1990s, with nuclear testing starting over a decade ago.
Not a good idea considering China trade constitutes almost 100% of our economy...and the rest we owe them in debt.
Thanks to our efforts to sabotage them, we're only helpiing them hone their skills.  Keep up the good work.
Not secet anymore, who is leaking? I hope  they find him or her, secret info leaked law violation. Anyone who works with classified, knows about a Non disclosure agreement.
The threat of nuclear annihilation is further proof that the human race is a flawed species. We should have stayed in the trees for another million years.

I find your statement: "I daresay America is disliked (hated even) and distrusted in most of the world despite what our politicians tell us to the contrary" to be extremely offensive.  I ask you:  why on earth would Europe feel this way?  or Austrailia?  or South America?  Certainly, the Russians probably don't trust us, and the Middle East has reason to have issues with us, but your blanket statement is simply absurd, and as I said, offensive.
All of this only make sense post re-unification though. While North Korea remains viable, and a viable threat, there is no deal to be made.

It would be useful if P45 seemed to have a real clue about this. As he gets his news from Fox and the alt-right media and his advice from the Russians, we should expect several NK missile shots across the bow as nothing more than help in allowing him to rage and compete to be the center of attention. Hope you have your potassium iodide handy and a shelter to hide in for a few months since shooting the live nukes will be his way of getting the last promo in his "No, No. Look at ME!" game

Well, this is exactly the sort of situation that demands a steady head and hand and team of dedicated and experienced states-people. Of which we have near zero currently on board.

We have an oil executive with questionable ties to Russia as our Secy of State, no assistant Secy of State (for who knows what Trump-gut reasons) and qualified staffers fleeing like Syrian refugees. (in all agencies)

A president prone to making unsubstantiated claims, like a petulant teen. Who lives to self-aggrandize, and play-act at shirt and tie chest thumping like he's a real warrior. Surrounded by a bunch of scavengers looking to expand their portfolios - all while ignoring the orange-tinted beastie in the room.

We need China (ghina!) South Korea, Japan and even Russia (as well as others) on board with an effective diplomatic (first) mission, coupled with a firm, but not too quick to shoot military hands. All of the above, other then Russia, the current Prez. has insulted and vilified in some manner.

So we can either prepare for the worst diplomatic/military debacle since GWB's Iraq and Afghanistan non-plans, or we can hope the GOP wakes the @%S&#! up and impeaches the Distracted (with applause and lies) in Chief

Not being a praying, or a half full all the time type, Im looking at living in a nation that will likely commit a heinous mistake of which there will be no excuses, except a small segment of the population thought it a good idea to elect a TV celebrity who made empty promises.

Once again. Americans proving their ignorance and unfamiliarity with World History, by all too easily blaming this all on the previous administration.
It's no so wonder they've ended up with what they now have in the White House.
Just a suggestion.
Google North Korea -- you'll find this problem didn't suddenly pop-up 8 years ago.

Is this all true? I mean there's a lot of hyperbole here -- the DPRK hasn't finished developing the missiles that could possibly reach the US and there's nothing here about whether their nukes have been miniaturized to fit the missiles that haven't been finished.

Lots of speculation.

Quite a juxtaposition. Aids scribbling on 4500 yr old technology as their boss celebrates unproductive military hardware while his countrymen and women use rationed food and electricity.  Kim's propaganda machine is quite effective.  He couldn't hold power if his people knew the truth:  They don't need his protection from the west.  They need protection from him.
Trump is sooo gonna bring on a nuclear war. And make the Stone Age great again.
Two mentally ill leaders one day may face-off, and we're in the middle. They both have bunkers.
Two people who are definitely bonkers have bunkers. Good analogy there.
